Sure! Here are some additional tips for getting motivated when you just don't feel like doing household chores:

1. Change your mindset: Instead of thinking of your chores as a burden, try to view them as a way to take care of yourself and your home. Remember that a clean and organized home can improve your mood and overall wellbeing. 2. Give yourself a deadline: Set a specific amount of time that you'll devote to cleaning and stick to it. Knowing that you only have a limited amount of time can help you stay focused and motivated. 3. Use positive reinforcement: Promise yourself a reward after completing your chores, such as watching your favorite TV show or treating yourself to your favorite snack. 4. Enlist help: Enlist the help of family and friends, or even hire a professional cleaner, to make the tasks feel less overwhelming and more manageable. 5. Make it fun: Try to inject some fun into your chores, such as by listening to music, playing a game with yourself (such as trying to beat your previous time), or incorporating a friend (such as cleaning together with music on). Ultimately, the best trick is to find what works well for you and make the chores more manageable and enjoyable.
